main event: An unidentified object was observed near Blytheville AFB, Arkansas on November 8, 1957.
interesting points: The object was detected on radar and observed visually for 65 minutes, traveling at speeds between 1,000-1,500 mph.
The observer believed the object was a satellite (likely ECHO II).
Other radar observations and visual sightings of unidentified objects were reported in the area around the same time.
The report mentions that the object's movement was erratic at times, moving in a westerly direction and then in an 'erratic fashion'.
The object was estimated to be at an altitude of around 1,000 feet and approximately 100 feet in diameter.
sighted object: A fast-moving unidentified object observed on radar and visually
